meanings.definition: To run faster than someone else in a race.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah managed to outsprint her competitors and reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: In the sprint event, the athlete with the ability to outsprint others usually wins.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outsprint his speedy opponent.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outsprint his own limitations pushed him to train harder every day.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's natural ability to outsprint any other land animal is truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The new sports car can easily outsprint all other vehicles on the road.
meanings.sent2: When chasing its prey, the predator can outsprint it to catch a meal.
meanings.sent3: The race between the turtle and the rabbit ended unexpectedly when the turtle managed to outsprint the rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to outsprint the fastest runner, blowing past with incredible speed.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's engines roared to life, ready to outsprint any obstacle in its path.
